reviews.review_msg: I am wait for 1 semester to take this B2B courses. Lisa's focus is Sustainability and 0 waste strategy. Those topic are good, but we are taking B2B courses!!!   About the project, I learned nothing. But You have to write what you learned from B2B's readings and implement it in the B2C Project weekly.  I hope I haven't taken this class sincerely.

she really cares about students but don't expect her to teach you materials from the textbook (although all exams are based on the textbook), you have to learn that on your own .. make sure you've got a good group!
Lisa is a good marketing professor. She certainly knows her field. In terms of lectures, she likes to connect students' comments to form her own arguments. Overall interesting class.
She is absolutely an amazing prof! One of the best profs I had. Truly cares about her students and makes lectures fun with in class activities that help us learn the course concepts for that week

Through her style of teaching it is evident that she knows what she is doing and truly cares about the well being of students. She put a lot of time and effort into explaining course material in detail which was greatly appreciated. When asked questions she happily answered them and grading is fair. Overall, great prof and definitely recommend.
Very neurotic and defensive. Very vague with assignment expectations and deducts lots of points for minor mistakes. Worst teacher ever.

She doesn't have a clear grading criteria for anything and there are no proper instructions. Even if you talk to her, youre still left guessing what she wants. She's an easy marker to the curve is really high so beware! I would not recommend. What a waste of my time.

Zahra is a great prof! She wants her students to do well and is a fairly easy marker, however I find that may not be the best for Beedie considering we are graded on a curve :(. Everyone basically gets the same marks for everything other than the midterm so be sure to put your all into that. Also, make sure to reach out to her outside class often.

The only mark that matters is the exam as everyone receive the same/similar marks for the other things. You need to do well in the exam to do well in this class. The exam is not related to the textbook, so i suggest only focusing on topics are red in the slides. Zahra is a easy marker & never teaches the full lecture. Overall I recommend her class
From what I have seen in class, her teaching style and personality are better reflected by the reviews she received when she was at UBC rather than SFU

The midterm was not very relevant to the course or study material. It was based on a case study and the questions were more about the article than it was about the application of knowledge. The questions were asking specific details within the article. For example, who were the owners? Did not feel like an exam worth 30%

The lectures go really off topic and don't relate to the textbook very well. Test questions topics are sometimes unrelated to the class. Occasionally snaps at students if they say something she doesn't like or finds boring. Seems very strict on students but not on herself. Any problem she doesn't want to resolve she will say "you're 4th years"
She's incredible and caring. She's also a major badass- I think everyone wanted to be her. She is a fairly easy marker, there are a bunch of quizzes but honestly it's all good. She's great.

Far-reaching and unrelated topics made it difficult to study or do assignments. Zahra fails at relating topics to each other even within the same slide. Reads off a pre-made slide deck while providing no additional information. Declared over half the chapters boring and unpractical. That isn't an excuse. You are the professor. Do something about it
